<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 4"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Mercy](/Feats.aspx?ID=5897) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Champion" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=811" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=227) pg. 95 <sup>1.1</sup>

**Archetypes** [Blessed One](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=51) (Level 6), [Blessed One](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=242) (Level 6)

**Prerequisites**
[_lay on hands_](/Spells.aspx?ID=2047)

</column>

---

Your touch soothes the body or mind. You can cast [_lay on hands_](/Spells.aspx?ID=2047) targeting a living creature using 2 actions instead of 1. If you do, you can attempt to [counteract](/Rules.aspx?ID=371) one condition of your choice affecting the target. When you select this feat, choose one of the following options, which determines the conditions you can choose: **Mercy of the Body** [blinded](/Conditions.aspx?ID=59), [dazzled](/Conditions.aspx?ID=65), [deafened](/Conditions.aspx?ID=66), [enfeebled](/Conditions.aspx?ID=71), [sickened](/Conditions.aspx?ID=91); **Mercy of Grace** [clumsy](/Conditions.aspx?ID=61), [grabbed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=77), [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=85); **Mercy of the Mind** [fleeing](/Conditions.aspx?ID=74), [frightened](/Conditions.aspx?ID=76), [stupefied](/Conditions.aspx?ID=94).

**Special** You can select this feat up to three times. Each time, choose a different type of mercy and add its options to those you can choose when you cast a 2-action _lay on hands_.

<title level="2">Mercy leads to...</title>
[Affliction Mercy](/Feats.aspx?ID=5912), [Blessed Spell](/Feats.aspx?ID=6279), [Greater Mercy](/Feats.aspx?ID=5904), [Ultimate Mercy](/Feats.aspx?ID=5929)
